page.title: 10Trellech Grange Church
page.content: Religion and farming go hand-in-hand as the church at Trellech Grange is situated in a farmyard. The services are held on the second Sunday of each month at ll o'clock. The vicar takes the service which lasts an hour. The congregation sings a hymn, then there's a bible reading and after that the people who are confirmed take communion. Next there is another hymn, then a reading from the pulpit and prayers. During the last hymn there is a collection made by the sidesman. In the monks' day Trellech Grange Church was used as a chapel for the Cistercians. In one year there are roughly l4 services. About 2O people attend the services on Sunday.
